title: Drawing, "Trude and John as Landscape, study for the Tapestry "Our Mountains"", ca. 1971
medium: Brush and green, blue and yellow watercolor over graphite on white wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed on drawing at center left, in black marking pen:  4/4/ x  2/2: at four corners of drawing, in graphite:  x; in upper left margin, in graphite (partly obliterated by tape residue):  3/21 / 4/1.
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Mountainous landscape incorporating the reclining profile face of John Elsesser (the artist's second husband), facing right, to create the mountain peaks and the profile face of Trude Guermonprez, facing left, to form the hills beneath.  Design is bordered in graphite.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Trude and John as Landscape, study for the Tapestry "Our Mountains"", ca. 1971.
ca. 1971. Brush and green, blue and yellow watercolor over graphite on white wove paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-108.
